parameters.name: op
parameters.description:
One of the following:

  
O_DSYNC â complete all queued operations as if
    done by calling
    fdatasync()
    (i.e., as defined for synchronized I/O data integrity completion).
    
  
O_SYNC â complete all queued operations as if
    done by calling
    fsync()
    (i.e., as defined for synchronized I/O file integrity completion).

parameters.name: aiocbptr
parameters.description:
A pointer to an asynchronous I/O control block of type
  aiocb
  for which you want to
  asynchronously force all queued I/O operations to the synchronized
  I/O completion state.

full_content:
Function: aio_fsync
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/aio_fsync.html
Synopsis: int aio_fsync( int op,
Headers: #include <aio.h>
Parameters:
  - op: One of the following:

  
O_DSYNC â complete all queued operations as if
    done by calling
    fdatasync()
    (i.e., as defined for synchronized I/O data integrity completion).
    
  
O_SYNC â complete all queued operations as if
    done by calling
    fsync()
    (i.e., as defined for synchronized I/O file integrity completion).
  - aiocbptr: A pointer to an asynchronous I/O control block of type
  aiocb
  for which you want to
  asynchronously force all queued I/O operations to the synchronized
  I/O completion state.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <aio.h>

int aio_fsync( int op, 
               struct aiocb * aiocbptr );
